channel.title: Freaking out
channel.description: I hosted a server a long time ago. Now, I cant get it to work and im freaking out. Couldnt forward a port. Now i got 43594 open with no-ip and utorrent and any time I load my server I get no response from server. WTF!

item.title: Freaking out
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“thomashawkins1991, post:10, topic:506816”][quote author=ladaswa link=topic=625049.msg4255759#msg4255759 date=1362721125]
Where?.. Theres no line like to add 127.0.0.1 like you showed
[/quote]
if urs is pi add the line somewhere… n it will work

[code]

	System.out.println("Server listening on port ###.#.#.#:" + serverlistenerPort);
	     

	 [/code][/quote]

No it won’t… That’s something the command prompt prints out. You can put in anything at all or remove the line entirely, nothing is effected.
I suggest you start learning java before trying to help people.

OP what’s your revision + base?

Read full topic

item.title: Freaking out
item.dc:creator: @thomashawkins1991 thomashawkins1991
item.description:
@thomashawkins1991 wrote:

ladaswa:

Change client to local? Are you talking about changing server = to my ip? Ive done that. And I only used no-ip because adding firewall exceptions and portforwarding my router didnt work for some reason. Yes the port is open though

HERE hope ur using pi
client.java hit ctrl+f
server = ###.#.#.#
put 127.0.0.1
server.java
to your ip

Read full topic

I hosted a server a long time ago. Now, I cant get it to work and im freaking out. Couldnt forward a port. Now i got 43594 open with no-ip and utorrent and any time I load my server I get no response from server. WTF!

goto
http://www.canyouseeme.org/
once ur there and ur port is open<> <is your router open? pain there to> if u need tut i have like 1000s i post
idk why everyone uses no-ip u dont have to?

remember to change ur client to local so u can connect.
